=== END BH10693 ===

=== START BH10694 ===

He is the Most Holy

How wonderful is this supreme abasement that hath once again touched Me in the path of God’s love! By God, it is dearer to Me than the kingdom of the heavens and earth, and I would not exchange it for aught else in all creation, whether past or future. Thy Lord is witness to what I say. Were We to look to this world, We would not have borne what no one else in all the worlds hath borne. It shall perish in an instant, while glory and dominion will endure forever with God and His loved ones, and praise be to God, the Lord of all worlds.

=== END BH10694 ===

=== START BH10695 ===

In His Name, the Manifest, the All-Knowing

O Hassan, upon thee be My glory! The Promise hath come, and the Promised One calleth out before the faces of the unseen and the seen, and commandeth them with that which draweth them near and acquainteth them with what was hidden from them. Verily thy Lord is the All-Bountiful, the All-Knowing, the All-Wise. Grieve not over anything, for that which hath been ordained for My loved ones is such that the pens of the world and the tongues of the sincere are powerless to describe. Thus hath He mentioned thee from His presence in a mighty Tablet. And this is what was revealed for His Honor Haji Aqa, upon him be the glory of God.

=== END BH10695 ===

=== START BH10696 ===

O Mulla Husayn Pasha (or Hasan)! The Wronged One remembers you as He sits upon the throne of command by the leave of God, the Protector, the Self-Subsisting. He has come with the truth to adorn the world with mercy and tranquility, but most of the people do not understand. They have clung to vain imaginings, turning away from the Sun of Certainty. Thus have their souls deluded them, and they do not see. Say: O concourse of the heedless! I swear by God! The promised day is come, the day when tormenting trials will have surged above your heads, and beneath your feet, saying: “Taste ye what your hands have wrought!”

=== END BH10696 ===

=== START BH10697 ===

O Hasan! Arise to serve with perfect wisdom. There are many souls whose inner reality differs from their outer appearance. Observe carefully lest you fall into the snare of the treacherous and the false ones. Not every utterance is worthy of acceptance, nor is it permissible to trust every soul. The people of God must be true money-changers, distinguishing the pure from the impure among men. If today in any place the clamor of the polytheists is raised, it has been and will be the cause of harm to the Tree. Drink thou the wine of divine love and give others to drink thereof.

=== END BH10697 ===

=== START BH10698 ===

He is the Manifest, the Speaking, the All-Knowing!

O Husayn! The Supreme Pen beareth witness to thy turning unto God, thy humility, thy submissiveness and thy resignation in the days of God, exalted be His glory. Well is it with thee and blessed art thou! We beseech God to aid thee under all conditions to preserve this mighty station. I swear by the lights of His countenance that whatsoever is witnessed cannot be compared with a single word from the words of God. Be thou thankful and among them that render praise.

=== END BH10698 ===

=== START BH10699 ===

O Husayn-Aqa! O Husayn! He Who was made a target for the arrows of the enemies in the path of God, the Lord of the Day of Judgment, makes mention of thee. Grieve thou not over anything. Remember thy Lord in the night season and in the days. Verily, this shall profit thee in every world among the worlds of thy Lord, the Mighty, the Peerless.

=== START BH10700 ===

Blessed art thou, and joy be unto thee, in that thou hast arisen to serve the Cause and art speaking in praise of God, the Lord of the worlds. Joy be unto him who hath heard from thee this Most Great News, and woe unto him who hath denied and become among those who have perished.

=== END BH10700 ===

=== START BH10701 ===

He is the All-Commanding, the All-Wise

O Rida! Verily the Wronged One is in manifest sorrow. My sorrow is not for the martyrdom of My loved ones, nor for what hath befallen Me at the hands of the divines of the Qur’an, nor from the kings and rulers. That which hath befallen Me is such as I do not wish to mention. To this My Most Exalted Pen beareth witness in this Great Prison. He who circled round Me made mention of thee. We make mention of thee in this wondrous Tablet. We beseech God to give thee to drink, from the cup of His bounty, the choice wine of His utterance. Verily, He is the All-Giving, the All-Bountiful.

=== END BH10701 ===

=== START BH10702 ===

Verily, Thou art the Omnipotent over what Thou willest, and Thou art indeed the Mighty, the Powerful.

He is the All-Bountiful

Send down upon him, O my God, a mercy from Thy presence and a light from Thy nearness. Verily, Thou art the Healer, the Sufficient, the Compassionate, the Forgiving.

Leave the cold to him who cannot distinguish his right hand from his left. The glory rest upon thee and upon those that are with thee from the presence of One mighty, all-wise.

=== START BH10706 ===

O Abbas! He is the One Whose power the might of the world could not prevent nor render weak. He appeared and with perfect steadfastness called out before the faces of all peoples, commanded all to that which God hath willed, and gave them the glad-tidings of the waves of the ocean of His grace.

=== START BH10707 ===

He is God! O ’Abbas! The world is receptive and its people are heedless. They seek after thorns and thistles - that is, vain imaginings and idle fancies - while turning away from the pearls of utterance, clinging instead to pebbles and date-stones. Today there are seekers for all things except the pearls of wisdom and utterance that have appeared from the treasury of the Most Exalted Pen. These remain without seeker or buyer. Ere long will the world change and people will eagerly seek after them with their very souls. Blessed are they that attain!

=== END BH10707 ===

=== START BH10708 ===

O ’Abdu’l-Husayn, upon him be the Glory of God!

He is the Most Holy, the Most Great, the Most Exalted, the Most Glorious!

All things have arisen in lamentation and wailing at this most great calamity, yet the people, being heedless, are unaware of it. Soon shall they become conscious of that which they have wrought against the truth in the days of God. Rejoice thou in that thou art under the gaze of thy Lord, the All-Knowing, the All-Wise.

=== START BH10709 ===

Cast aside what thou hast of idle fancies and take fast hold of the hem of thy Lord, the Lord of all mankind. He, verily, will suffice thee in truth. Thy Lord is, in truth, the All-Powerful, the Almighty. Be thou steadfast in the Cause and speak forth in remembrance of thy Lord, the Mighty, the All-Knowing.

=== START BH10723 ===

O Muhammad-Sadiq, upon him be the Glory of God

In the Name of God, the Lord of the Exalted Throne

We beseech God to aid all to hold fast unto it and to cling to its hem. Verily He is the Ordainer, the All-Wise, the Mighty, the Great.

=== START BH10724 ===

=== START BH10725 ===

He is the All-Seeing, the All-Knowing

=== START BH10726 ===

In My Name, the All-Seeing

Blessed art thou for having turned unto Him and believed. The glory of God rest upon thee and thy family, from God, the Revealer of verses.

=== START BH10727 ===

=== START BH10728 ===

O Muhammad-Rida, upon him be the Glory of God! He is the Helper! O Muhammad, before Rida! The Wronged One beareth witness to thy turning, thy acceptance, thy presence, and thy arising before the gate which was opened unto all who are in the heavens and on earth. We bear witness that thou hast drunk the choice wine of utterance from the hand of the bounty of thy Lord, the Most Merciful, and hast attained unto that which was inscribed by the Most Exalted Pen in the Books of God, the Lord of the worlds. We counsel thee to remain steadfast in this Cause whereby the feet of the mystics have slipped, save those whom God, the Lord of the worlds, hath willed.

=== END BH10728 ===

=== START BH10729 ===

O Muhammad (or Muhammad-i-Ya), the Day of praise and thanksgiving has come, wherein the Concourse on High rejoices, yet most of the people are as dead. Sleep has overtaken them in such wise that they remain heedless of the call of God, the Lord of the worlds. Blessed is he whose foot has not slipped from the Path, and blessed is the one possessed of vision who has turned towards the Most Great Horizon and has said: “Praise be unto Thee, O Thou Who art the Wronged One, the Lonely One, the Stranger.” Thus have We adorned the heaven of utterance with the stars of knowledge. Blessed is he who has recognized and prostrated himself before the face of God, the Mighty, the Praiseworthy.

=== START BH10730 ===

Thus have We adorned thy head with the crown of My leave, the Mighty, the Inaccessible, and thine ear with hearkening to My holy, glorious and wondrous call, and thy form with the robe of My loving-kindness, the Mighty, the Beauteous. This is what We informed the servants of before, and We inform you as a grace from Us. Verily your Lord is He Who has sovereignty over what was and what will be. The glory from Us be upon you and upon those who have taken the Book of God before all faces.

Verily, Thou art the Most Merciful of the merciful ones.

Remind the people of My days and acquaint them with that which behoveth them in this Day wherein I have raised the banner of ‘There is none other God but Me, the Mighty, the Great.’ Glory be upon thee and upon whosoever heareth thy words concerning this wondrous Cause.

Verily, Thou art the Ever-Forgiving, the All-Merciful.

=== START BH10739 ===

He is the Most Exalted, the Most Glorious

O Yahya! The promise hath come to pass, and the Spirit crieth out among the servants. Verily, those who lay claim to knowledge and wisdom have debarred themselves from this bounty that hath encompassed all regions. We have tested them and found them in wondrous doubt. Blessed art thou for having cast away vain imaginings and taken hold of the Book by the command of God, the Lord of all religions. The glory from Us be upon thee and upon those whom We have mentioned at this time through verses that have encompassed the earth and the heavens.

=== END BH10739 ===

=== START BH10740 ===

He is the Ever-Abiding

Whatsoever is in the heavens and on the earth and between them boweth down in adoration unto God, for verily there is no sovereign but Him. His is the creation and the command, and all are seized with trembling and convulsion through His might. He it is before Whose fear the thunder doth glorify Him, and the lightning through dread of Him, and He bringeth forth the signs from the kingdom of power and destiny. Say: Verily are all manifestations enshrouded by His bidding, and all winds stirred by His sovereignty, and none denieth this save every denier and vainglorious one.

=== END BH10740 ===

=== START BH10741 ===

He is the Helper

I testify that you have helped your Lord and were among the helpers. By My testimony all things bear witness - this is the foundation, were you to be among those who know. What you do by His command and good-pleasure is true help in the sight of your Lord, the All-Knowing, the All-Informed. Go forth but do not commit that which would cause sedition. Trust in God - verily He seizes whom He wishes and He has power over all things. We have accepted what you intended in the path of God. Return to your place, then remember your Lord, the Mighty, the Praiseworthy.

=== END BH10741 ===

=== START BH10742 ===

In the Name of God, the Most Holy, the All-Glorious!

O child of tender years!

Thy Lord invoketh, on thy behalf, His own Self, saying:

O Thou Who holdest within Thy grasp the Kingdom of names and the Empire of all things, Thou seest how I have become a stranger from my land on account of my love for Thee. I beg of Thee, by the beauty of Thy countenance, to make my remoteness from home a means whereby Thy servants may be drawn nigh unto the Fountain-head of Thy Cause and the Dayspring of Thy Revelation. O God, I call on Thee with a tongue that hath spoken no word of disobedience against Thee, imploring Thee, by Thy sovereignty and might, to keep me safe in the shelter of Thy mercy and to grant me strength to serve Thee and to serve my father and mother. Thou, verily, art the Almighty, the Help in Peril, the Self-Subsisting.

=== END BH10742 ===

=== START BH10743 ===

He is the Helper!

Mahd-i ’Ulya! As divine favour is these days all-embracing and the Afnans, upon them be God’s Glory, are under the Sidrih, a robe of honour was bestowed, a robe whose warp is the bounty of God and whose woof is His grace. From the beginning of the world until now no one had outwardly attained such a robe. Verily, God hath made this bounty a treasure and honour for thee. Two sets of chintz were sent, each set containing two robes - two specially for the mother of His honor Mirza and Umm-i-’Aliyyih, upon them be God’s grace, and two specially for Furugh and ’Aliyyih, and one specially for Jamilih. These should be sewn and given so that on special days they may adorn their frames of submission therewith and be occupied with the remembrance of God and these days. We send greetings and glorification to all. The Glory be upon you.

=== END BH10743 ===

=== START BH10744 ===

Say: Beware, O people of Baha, lest the strong ones of the earth rob you of your strength, or they who rule the world fill you with fear. Put your trust in God, and commit your affairs to His keeping. He, verily, will, through the power of truth, render you victorious, and He, verily, is powerful to do what He willeth, and in His grasp are the reins of omnipotent might.

=== END BH10744 ===

=== START BH10745 ===

O God! O God! We beg of Thee by all the Names by which Thou art known, to exalt the humiliation of Thy chosen ones by Thy glory, their weakness by Thy strength, their impotence by Thine omnipotence, their poverty by Thy wealth, and their fear by Thine assurance.

O Lord, illumine our hearts by the light of knowing Thee. O Lord! Behold these thirsty ones journeying toward the river of Thy bestowal and hastening to the ocean of Thy generosity.

Verily, Thou art the powerful, the mighty, the benevolent!

=== END BH10745 ===

=== START BH10746 ===

Be fair, ye peoples of the world; is it meet and seemly for you to question the authority of one Whose presence ‘He Who conversed with God’ (Moses) hath longed to attain, the beauty of Whose countenance ‘God’s Well-beloved’ (Muhammad) had yearned to behold, through the potency of Whose love the ‘Spirit of God’ (Jesus) ascended to heaven, for Whose sake the ‘Primal Point’ (the Bab) offered up His life?

=== END BH10746 ===

=== START BH10747 ===

The day is approaching when the wrathful anger of the Almighty will have taken hold of them. He, verily, is the Omnipotent, the All-Subduing, the Most Powerful. === START BH10751 ===

He is God! If thou remainest firm in the love of God, the wellsprings of divine wisdom will flow from thy heart and tongue, and thou wilt become aware of the meanings of the divine words, for His love hath ever been and shall continue to be the teacher of pure hearts and sanctified souls. Its effulgences remain concealed and hidden behind the veil of the heart. Rend thou the veil, that the lights of its revelation may shine forth upon the Sinai of thy breast.

=== END BH10751 ===

=== START BH10752 ===

He is the All-Explaining, the All-Knowing

Praise be to God Who hath broken the seal of the choice Wine with the finger of power and hath caused to descend from the heaven of utterance that whereby all things have proclaimed: “The Kingdom belongeth to Him Who hath appeared with the truth with such conclusive proof as hath caused all necks to bow down.” O Ghulam-Husayn! === START BH10753 ===

He is God, exalted be His station! Praise be to God alone, and salutations upon Him after Whom there shall be no Prophet. O my God and my Lord! === END BH10753 ===

=== START BH10754 ===

He is God, exalted be His station, His grandeur and His power!

Praise be to the Lord of the worlds Who, through His supreme Word, adorned the peoples from nothingness with the ornament of existence, and through His blessed Word of unity provided instruction. Whoso attaineth unto it attaineth unto all that is in the first and last worlds. To this the tongue of proof in the Kingdom of utterance doth testify.

Glorified art Thou, O my God, my Lord and my Support! This servant desireth to make mention of Thee and to praise Thee, yet findeth himself prevented from that which he desireth, for I know of a certainty that mention of aught else but Thee reacheth not unto Thee nor ascendeth to the heaven of Thy Cause and the atmosphere of Thy Will. I beseech Thee, O God of the seen and unseen, by Thy Name which Thou hast made the Sovereign of all names, and by Thy Command which hath encompassed earth and heaven, to enable me to do that which befitteth the court of Thy glory and the carpet of Thy nearness. O Lord! Thou knowest and seest that I desire to make mention of Thy Afnan whom Thou hast exalted through Thy Tablets and aided through Thy unseen hosts. I beseech Thee by the lights of Thy countenance to open before their faces the doors of Thy glory and bounty. Verily, Thou art the Almighty, before Whose power the power of all things hath proven powerless. There is no God but Thee, the Sender down of verses and the Manifestor of clear proofs.

My spirit be a sacrifice unto your mention and your utterance! Your noble letter arrived, bringing to mind the days of attaining your presence and meeting. In truth, when one attaineth unto the presence and meeting of holy and sanctified souls, in one respect he hath attained unto Paradise. In any case, after the arrival of the letter and its reading and observation, and the manifestations of joy and gladness and delight and enthusiasm and expansion, we proceeded to the Holy Shrine and presented it before His blessed face, and He said […]

The Seal of the Prophets - may our souls be a sacrifice for Him - hath declared: “A time shall come upon My people when no one’s religion shall remain secure except for those who flee from peak to peak…” In truth, that time is this time. This Wronged One and those who love Him are all clinging to the cord of resignation and the hem of contentment. This people have ever been, and continue to be, possessed of the utmost love towards the government and people of Iran, to such an extent that none of the peoples in diverse regions have been as obedient to the government’s commands as this people. This fact is evident and manifest to all. Nevertheless, you witness the conduct of those associated with the government - how they daily inflict harm upon ones such as yourselves, whom all know harbor no ill intent toward anyone and who deal with God’s servants with trustworthiness, love and kindness. Glory be to God! One is bewildered how they could consent to attribute theft to you who are among the most honored people of Iran, spreading it by word in that city and by telegraph to outlying regions, executing and carrying out whatever the slanderers say. Glory be to God! Where has honor gone, and what has become of care and kindness? It is reported that His Excellency the Ambassador, the Most Noble Mu’inu’l-Mulk - may God strengthen him - has arrived. What did he say and what did he declare? We beseech God to assist him in executing justice. Verily He is powerful over all things. Praise be to God, His Majesty the Shah of Iran in these days deals with this people with the utmost kindness and love, and each day there appears from him that which is a truthful witness and an eloquent testimony to his grace and favor. We beseech God, blessed and exalted be He, to cause through him the standards of His justice to be raised among His creation and the banners of His grace to be unfurled amidst His creatures. Verily He is the Powerful, the Mighty, the All-Choosing. Peace and mercy be upon you and upon those with you who love you and serve you for the sake of God, the Lord of the Mighty Throne. Indeed this servant is bewildered, for in the early stages of affairs in Astaneh, there was hope that through God’s grace - exalted be His glory - and the assistance of His Excellency the Ambassador, the Most Noble Mu’inu’l-Mulk - may God, blessed and exalted be He, strengthen him - matters would be concluded with justice. However, thereafter that which caused despair became manifest. For some time now the Master - may our spirits be a sacrifice for Him - has said nothing. Occasionally some associates have approached the Most Exalted Station and, with the utmost humility and submissiveness, inquired about the reason for this silence and its cause. Nevertheless, not a word has issued from His blessed tongue except that one day He said: “He is the All-Patient; He has commanded you to beautiful patience. He is the Concealer; He has commanded you to mighty concealment.” This servant in all conditions beseeches and hopes that the All-Glorious Truth may make the rulers aware of the sweetness, delight, loftiness and greatness of justice, and not deprive His servants of this supreme bounty and most evident light. He is powerful and mighty over all things.

Mention was made of the spiritual friend His honor Aqa Azizu’llah, upon him Baha’u’llah. Their attention towards those parts where they have gone is fitting. Wherever they may be, I beseech from God, exalted be His glory, bounty and favor for them. Verily God our Lord is the Compassionate, the Generous. Unceasingly do they circle round in remembrance of your honor and beseech from God, exalted be His station, whatsoever is the cause of eternal salvation and glory.

My God, my God! Assist Thy Afnan to that which beseemeth Thy glory, Thy grandeur and Thy power. Verily Thou art the One Who hath power over whatsoever He willeth. There is none other God but Thee, the Mighty, the All-Forgiving.

Regarding the shop you wrote about - it is very good, for it provides employment for the two brothers, upon them Baha’u’llah. It is both a means of occupation and livelihood - blessed from both aspects, God willing, it has been and is. Praise be to God, both honored loved ones have attained unto the word “Nasr”, meaning they are designated with the victory of God. It is hoped that the third victory will be the advancement of the affairs of the wronged community in the world, and likewise the advancement of your honor’s affairs. With the generous ones, tasks are not difficult. This servant conveys greetings and praise to them and beseeches from God glory, bounty, exaltation and blessing for them. And God is the Hearer, the Answerer.

Concerning mention of the spiritual beloved His honor Aqa Ahmad, upon him Baha’u’llah, you wrote that he has gone to Alexandria and until now no news has come from him. We beseech God, blessed and exalted be He, to unite your company from all directions. Verily He is the Mighty, the Bestower. In this land also, until now no one suitable for work there has appeared, except for the beloved of the heart His honor Haji Siyyid Javad, upon him Baha’u’llah, who has arrived. There is intention today to mention this matter to him - perhaps he will give it attention.

Another matter is that the beloved of the heart His honor Nazir, upon him Baha’u’llah, said that during the days they were at the Threshold they observed a letter with you, either in the handwriting of the beloved of the heart His honor Ismu’l-Jud, upon him Baha’u’llah, or from here which by command was to appear that your honor should write that His honor Ibrahim Effendi, upon him be God’s peace, should not send tobacco to His honor Aqa Nuru’llah and His honor Aqa Ali-Muhammad, upon them Baha’u’llah. God forbid! God forbid! No such command has appeared from the Most Exalted Horizon, and mention of these matters has not occurred in this land. Outwardly it is not known who has committed such a falsehood. Knowledge is with God in His clear Book. In these days they have shown kindness toward His honor Effendi, upon him be God’s peace, and said: We beseech God, blessed and exalted be He, to assist him with the hosts of the invisible and visible realm, to open before his face the gates of favor, and to send down upon him from the clouds of His mercy a blessing from His presence and a mercy from His side. Verily He is the Most Merciful of the merciful ones and the Most Generous of the generous ones. O Ibrahim! Trust in all matters in God, the Lord of the Tree and the Mount, and commit thy affairs unto Him. Verily He is the Gracious, the Effusive, the Trustworthy, the All-Wise. And say […]

O my God, my God! I beseech Thee by the waves of the ocean of Thy mercy, and by the pearls hidden in the depths of Thy bounty, and by Thy Prophets and Thy Messengers and Thy Books and Thy Scriptures, to aid me to remember Thee and praise Thee, and to practice righteousness and godliness through Thy care and Thy bestowal. Ordain for me the good of this world and the world to come. Verily, Thou art the Lord of all names, and within Thy grasp is the dominion of all who are in the heavens and on earth.

From what is evident, the station of the Master’s favors toward His Honor Effendi is clear and manifest, requiring no further mention. This evanescent servant beseeches the Eternal Truth to withhold not from any of the peoples of the earth His infinite mercy and boundless grace, and to adorn all with the ornament of truthfulness and illumine them with the light of justice. Verily, He is powerful over all things.

In these days, the beloved of my heart, His Honor Nazir, upon him be Baha’u’llah’s glory, is present and residing in the vicinity. He mentioned His Honor Effendi, upon him be Baha’u’llah’s glory, and requested a Tablet for his son. After it was presented before Him, He showed His favor. It is hoped that an exalted Tablet will issue forth from the Dawning-Place of generosity and be sent. The two large containers of cheese that His Honor Effendi and other souls, upon them be God’s peace, sent have arrived. It is hoped that God, exalted be His glory, will manifest its recompense and assist them in that which is the cause and means of everlasting remembrance, as well as the cause of eternal blessing. In truth, what they sent was very good and outstanding, and praise be to God, it was honored with acceptance in His presence. Blessed be he and them. And the beloved of my heart, His Honor Nazir, has requested tobacco from His Honor Effendi. God willing, they will send it and be assisted in deeds that are the cause of the Friend’s good-pleasure. Peace and praise and remembrance and glory be upon you all and upon those with you and those who love you and hear your words for the sake of God, our Lord and your Lord and the Lord of all who are in the heavens and on earth. And praise be to God, the Lord of the worlds.

The Servant

7 Jamadi’l-Avval 1308

=== START BH10770 ===

O Shaykh-’Ali-Mirza, upon thee be the Glory of God, the Most Glorious! Preserve this most exalted station through the name of thy Lord, the Most Glorious. Soon shalt thou behold the effects of that which We have bestowed upon thee. Verily, thy Lord is the Rememberer, the All-Informed.

=== START BH10779 ===

and without being taught writing I write. All this is evident unto those

who have eyes as this emanates from the world of the Interior. Those who

are outside have been and still are unaware of this great mystery.

He is the Mighty!

I swear by God that whatsoever is visible shall soon come to an end, and the mercy of the Spirit encompasseth thee and whomever returneth unto Him. And this is boundless grace. Be not heedless.

=== START BH10814 ===

He is God, exalted be His glory in wisdom and utterance!

Praise befitteth and is meet for the Lord of the Day of Judgment, Who hath illumined the contingent world with the lights of utterance and adorned it with the blessed word “The Kingdom is God’s.” Neither the might of the polytheists nor the clamor of the heedless could prevent the penetration of His perfect Word, nor could the power of the aggressors weaken the authority of His Most Exalted Pen. With but a single pen He arose against the whole world, and gave glad tidings to all of the Great Announcement which was among the irrevocable promises of God, and guided them. Yet weak eyes were prevented from beholding the horizon of manifestation, and ears that heard not were deprived of hearkening to the Most Sweet Call and the scratching of the Most Exalted Pen. Glorified be His dominion and magnified be His proof. There is no God but Him.

My God, my God, my Lord, my Support, my Goal, my Beloved and the Ultimate Object of my desire! Thou seest the turning of Thy loved ones to the horizon of Thy manifestation, their orientation to the lights of Thy countenance, and their arising to serve Thy Cause. I beseech Thee, O my Lord, by the Call that was raised from Thy most exalted horizon, by Thy Light wherewith the earth and heaven were illumined, and by the Fire of Thy Lote-Tree whereby Thou didst guide Moses on Mount Sinai, to ordain for whosoever hath turned unto Thee in Thy days and made mention of Thy servant, the Wondrous One, Who hath been imprisoned in the jail of Thine enemies, that which beseemeth the heaven of Thy bounty and bestowal. O my Lord! Thou knowest that he desired naught but to demonstrate his love for Thee in this Day wherein the fire of hatred hath been kindled in the breasts of the worshippers of names. O my Lord! Guard him through Thy grace, then aid him through Thy power and sovereignty that he may arise to serve Thee among Thy servants and assist Thee through wisdom and utterance. Verily Thou art the Confirmer, the Mighty, the Bountiful.

Then I beseech Thee, O God of Names and Creator of earth and heaven, to ordain for me from Thy Most Exalted Pen the recompense of those who have aimed at the Ultimate Goal and the Most Exalted Summit, and whom the attraction of Thy verses seized in such wise that they turned to the place of sacrifice and spent their wealth and souls in Thy path, O Lord of all beings and King of the kingdom of names. Verily Thou art powerful over what Thou willest and in Thy grasp are the reins of all in the earths and the heavens.

=== START BH10840 ===

He is!

Glorified be He Who is established upon the throne and Who rules as He pleases with the sovereignty of His command. And verily He is this and this is He, but the people are in delusion, then in conjecture, then in doubt, then in drunkenness and heedlessness and in a veil thicker than all thick things and heavier than the weight of the heavens and earth - and none knows this save the detached ones.

Glorified be God for this moving, gleaming Spirit!

=== START BH10905 ===

Faran Mirza Kuchak

He is the Ruler over whatsoever He willeth!

Thy letter hath come before the Throne and hath been illumined by the light of thy Lord’s countenance, the Powerful, the Supreme, the Mighty, the All-Wise. Therein thou didst call upon God, thy Lord, the Lord of the Throne and of the dust, and the Lord of all the worlds, and didst seek from Him that which beseemeth not those who have detached themselves in the love of God from all else besides Him. Beware lest thou be among the heedless. Read thou what hath been sent down from the Supreme Pen in the Tablets of thy Lord, and be of them whom the breezes of revelation have so seized that they have forsaken the world and all that is therein, clinging fast to the Most Firm Handle. We have revealed to the King of Iran: “O King! Wert thou to hear the shrill voice of the Most Exalted Pen and the cooing of the Dove of Eternity upon the branches of the Divine Lote-Tree in remembrance of God, the Creator of Names and Fashioner of earth and heaven, it would bring thee to a station wherein thou wouldst behold in existence naught save the effulgence of the Worshipped Beauty, and wouldst see sovereignty as the most contemptible thing, leaving it to whomsoever might desire it, and would turn toward the Horizon which shineth with the light of His Countenance.” And We revealed to the King of Paris: “Dost thou take pride in the treasures thou dost possess, when thou knowest they shall perish? Or dost thou glory in that thou rulest a span of earth, when all of it, in the estimation of the people of Baha, is worth not even as much as the black in the eye of a dead ant? Leave them to such as desire them and turn unto the Most Great Purpose. The poor man is he who beareth this weighty burden, and the lowly one is he who taketh pride in such fleeting glory. Choose thou for thyself that which God hath chosen for thee. He ordaineth for whomsoever He willeth that which profiteth him in this world and the next. He is verily the Forgiving, the Generous. Thou knowest not what profiteth thee. He, verily, knoweth better than thou, wert thou of them who are informed. Be thou content with what God hath been pleased to ordain for thee, and place thy trust in Him in all matters. He is verily the Protector of those who trust in Him.” What thou didst seek - verily it was not mentioned before thy Lord. By My life! It is the source of pride and vainglory. It beseemeth not him who hath clung to the hem of detachment in this Most Holy, Most Mighty, Most Exalted, Most Wondrous Day. Say: O my God! I beseech Thee by Thy Name, the All-Encompassing over all things, to ordain for me that which shall profit me in this world and the next, and shall establish me in Thy service amongst Thy creatures. Verily, Thou art powerful over whatsoever Thou willest. There is no God but Thee, the Giving, the Bountiful, the Mighty, the Compassionate. Then forgive me, O my God, for what I have done in Thy days, and by Thy grace and bounty absolve me of my misdeeds. Verily, Thou art powerful over this from time immemorial.

=== END BH10905 ===

=== START BH10906 ===

He is the All-Glorious! O my God! Then grant him that which will cause him to ascend unto the stations of nearness, “the distance of two bow-lengths or even less.”

=== START BH10913 ===

He is the Most High, the Most Exalted

Thus hath My Most Exalted Pen spoken, to the shame of every infidel who hath disbelieved in God, the Lord of the Throne and of the dust.

=== START BH10914 ===

He is the Most Exalted, the All-Glorious

=== START BH10945 ===

He is the One Who has stirred all created things with the finger of His will!

A mention from the One Who is mentioned unto him who has turned with his heart, confessed with his tongue, heard with his ear, and arisen upon his feet to the remembrance of God and the service of His Cause in days wherein the Herald has called out in all directions: “The Self-Subsisting has come with the Kingdom of verses and His sealed wine!” Beware, O people of the earth, lest ye deprive yourselves of the most pure wine which the hands of the bounty of your Lord, the Possessor of Destiny, do proffer. Draw nigh with radiant faces, then drink thereof in His Name, the Mighty, the Loving. Thus has the ocean of proof surged before all religions when the Pen of God, Lord of what was and what shall be, did move. Say: Fear God, O people, and follow not your desires. Follow Him Who has come to you with the Tablet of proof and the Kawthar of utterance, then drink thereof through My remembrance, the Mighty, the Inaccessible.

O Zayn! Upon thee be the Glory of God, His mercy and His favor. The Most Great Branch appeared before the countenance of the Lord of mankind and mentioned thee. We make mention of thee with that whereby the hearts of the Concourse on High, the dwellers of the Most Exalted Paradise, and the Supreme Heaven have been attracted. Blessed is he who has heard and recognized, and woe unto every heedless and veiled one.

O Zayn! By My life and My Cause, every letter that appears from My Most Exalted Pen calls out with the most loud cry in the kingdom of creation: “O concourse of earth and heaven! Open your eyes, for the Chosen One has come with a sovereignty before which the sovereignty of the world cannot stand, and with a Command which the armies of the nations cannot prevent.” To this testifies every fair-minded one and every just one who has spoken the truth concerning this Cause, whereby the limbs of all names have trembled and the heart of every heedless one who has denied God, the Protector, the Self-Subsisting, has been disturbed.

O Zayn! There has come before the Wronged One a letter sent by one of My servants who heard My call and turned to My direction. He has been named Hassan by the Tongue of Grandeur in this praiseworthy station. Give him My glad-tidings and remind him of My verses. Say: O Hassan! Rejoice that thy mention has flowed at this moment from the Pen of God, the Lord of the worlds. He has sent thee from the palm tree of utterance the fresh dates of knowledge, and from the Tree of Sinai the melody of God, the Powerful, the Mighty, the Beloved. By My life! If thou wouldst hear with thine ear, it would call out and say: “O people of earth and heaven! By God, the regions have been perfumed by the fragrance of utterance wafted from God, the Lord of existence. Cast the rejectors behind you and turn to the Word which, when it shone forth from the horizon of the heaven of the Pen, caused those of Sinai to swoon in the land of extinction, save whom God willed, the Lord of the Frequented House.”

O Hassan! Observe, then mention what the tongues of the rejectors have uttered in this promised Day. The Most Great News has come unto them, whereby the Books of God, both past and future, have been adorned with verses that have filled the horizons and with clear proofs that have erased the traces of discord. Yet most people are unaware. They have cast the ocean behind them, playing with a mere pond, and they do not understand. Say: O people of Baha! Counsel the servants through deeds and character. This is what ye were commanded aforetime by God. Fear God and be not of those who see and deny. Say: Hear the call of God with your ears, then behold the Light shining from the horizon of the Cause with your eyes, nay rather with the eye of God, the Lord of the unseen and the seen. Verily, My Herald - upon him be My glory, My favor, and My mercy - commanded all to look upon My verses with My eyes, but the people turned away from what he said and took for themselves a path to tyranny […]

We desire at this time to make mention of those whom thou hast mentioned, that the rapture of this remembrance may seize them in such wise that neither the vanities of the world nor the wealth of kings and subjects may deter them.

O Muhammad! We have turned unto thee at this hour and make mention of thee in truth, inasmuch as thy name was presented before the Wronged One. When thou dost inhale the fragrance of My utterance from the direction of My prison, say:

My God, my God! Thy call hath attracted me, Thy grace hath guided me, Thy bounty hath given me to drink, and Thy generosity hath encompassed me. I beseech Thee, O God of the world and Creator of the nations, by Thy Most Great Name through which the fire of hatred was kindled in the breasts of the perverse ones and the light of the Cause shone in the hearts of them that have recognized Thee, and by the Word at whose appearance all the books of the world submitted to it, to ordain for me through Thy All-Knowing Pen that which shall abide with me in all the worlds of Thy worlds. Thou, verily, art powerful over whatsoever Thou pleasest, and within Thy grasp are the reins of all affairs.

We also make mention in this place of thy brother as a token of grace from Us, and verily We are the All-Bountiful, the Most Generous. The glory from Us be upon thee and upon him and upon thy wife and upon those who are with thee among the people of Baha who have not been hindered by the intimations of the heedless nor by the might of those who have disbelieved in the Day of Judgment.

We make mention in this place of him who was named Siyyid ’Ali, that the fragrances of My revelation may attract him and draw him nigh unto My glorious and wondrous Kingdom. O ’Ali! Hearken unto the call from the direction of ’Akka. Verily it hath been raised in truth from One Who is All-Knowing, All-Informed. We beseech God to ordain for thee the reward of attaining His presence and standing before His face and arising to serve His wondrous Cause, and to aid thee in that whereby thy remembrance and thy name shall endure in His perspicuous Book. By the life of God! The Wronged One loveth to meet His loved ones, but the oppressors have intervened between Me and them and have committed that which hath caused the Spirit of Faithfulness to lament. When thou drinkest the choice wine of My praise from the hand of My bounty, say:

My God, my God! The wine of Thy utterance hath intoxicated me and the Kawthar of Thy knowledge hath attracted me. I beseech Thee by Thy Name through which the One Who conversed on Sinai spoke forth and the decree of resurrection appeared and the dwellers of the graves arose, and by Thy standing and Thy sitting, and by the breezes of Thy revelation and the sending down of Thy verses, to ordain for me the reward of those who have sought Thy presence and circled round Thy throne and hearkened unto Thy call and beheld Thy horizon. O Lord! Thou seest the poor one seeking the Ultimate Goal and the wronged one the manifestations of Thy justice, O Lord of all being and Sovereign of the throne on high and of the dust below. I beseech Thee to ordain for me that which shall make me steadfast in Thy Cause and firm in Thy love and active in carrying out what Thou hast revealed in Thy Books. Verily Thou art the Powerful One Who, when Thy power is manifested, obliterateth all traces of the world’s power, and when the Day-Star of Thy will shineth forth, the wills of all nations are struck dumb. There is no God but Thee, the Almighty, the All-Powerful, and worthy to grant requests.

He is the Compassionate from the horizon of the Prison.

O Muhammad! The letter from Siyyid Muhammad, upon him be Baha, was presented before the Wronged One and was heard. Praise be to God, he hath repeatedly attained unto the divine verses. Today every word that appeareth from the Dayspring of God’s Will concerning His sincere ones and those near unto Him shall endure throughout the kingdom of earth and heaven. O Muhammad! God willing, thou shalt hold fast unto wisdom and utterance and engage in teaching God’s Cause. Today the ocean of verses surgeth, and the heaven of proof is adorned with the stars of evidence, and such rains of utterance and meanings have been sent down from the heaven of divine mercy that those who circle round have been unable to reckon them. Nevertheless, the deniers have said that which no oppressor hath ever said, to such extent that before Our face they busy themselves with misleading some heedless soul from the path. Thus do We recount unto thee what hath befallen Me at the hands of the heedless ones. Say: O deniers! Like unto the former people, deprive not yourselves of the effulgent lights of the Day-Star of Manifestation. Rend asunder the veils in the name of the True One and shatter the idols of vain imaginings with the arm of certitude. How long will ye worship fancy, and till when will ye pursue vain imaginings? Today the breezes of God are wafting, and the fragrances of divine revelation are diffused, and the tongue of utterance speaketh before the faces of all who are in the realm of being. Let go and take up - let go that which the people possess and take up that which cometh from the horizon of the heaven of God’s bounty. Today the fruits of the Ultimate Tree are visible, the Mount Sinai speaketh in praise of the Lord of Manifestation, and the Lote-Tree circleth round the House. Well is it with him who showeth equity in the Cause of God, and woe unto the hesitators.

We make mention at this time of him who is named Ali, that he may give thanks unto God, the Lord of the Mighty Throne, and We remember Our loved ones in Kha and Ra - and verily I am the Forgiving, the Merciful.

O Muhammad! We have made mention and continue to make mention of all the loved ones, and We counsel them to manifest great steadfastness. For twelve hundred years the people of Iran took pride over other religions in mentioning the Successor, yet when the Dayspring of God’s Will and the Dawning-Place of divine light - through Whose word the realm of mystical knowledge, successorship and imamate was and is created - shone forth from the horizon of purpose, all rushed forth with spears and arrows of rancor and hatred, and finally martyred Him. Until now they have not understood the station of the Day of God. Say: By the life of God! This is the Day wherein the Primal Point uttereth “I am the first of the worshippers” and the seat of the Throne is the circling-place of the Concourse on High. Say: Have mercy on yourselves and choose not eternal torment through love of vain imaginings and idle fancies. For the sake of God have We spoken and continue to speak, and in the path of God do We summon all to the supreme horizon. Say: O people! Know with clear certainty that until ye pass beyond the river of names, ye shall not attain unto the ocean of inner meanings. This is a word that was hidden in the treasuries of My Most Exalted Pen, and We have revealed it in truth and sent it forth with justice. Blessed is he who hath heard and said: “I believe in God, the Possessor of the seen and unseen.”

Repeatedly hath this word flowed from the tongue of grandeur: “Blessed are the people who know.” We beseech God to aid His loved ones to guide people through deeds and character, and to guide them to the Great Announcement. The glory from Us be upon him who hath heard the call and said: “Yea, yea, O Lord of Names! Yea, yea, O Lord of mankind! Here am I, here am I, O Master of the Throne and earth, and Sovereign of the hereafter and of former times!”

=== END BH10945 ===

CLXVI

=== START BH10983 ===

O Muhammad-Baqir of Yazd, upon him be the Glory of God, He Who dominates all who are on earth and in heaven! O Baqir! Your mention came before the Wronged One and the gaze of favor was directed toward you. The True One, exalted be His glory, has appeared with enduring bounties and heavenly sustenance, and stands before the faces of the world. Yet most of the peoples turned away and rose up against Him. The kings saw no benefit for themselves in acknowledging Him, and likewise the ministers and clergy, even though in the divine Books and Scriptures the Purpose has been clearly and explicitly made manifest, and the True One has proclaimed in the most exalted utterance that this supreme Manifestation has come for the reformation of the world and the advancement of the peoples. The intention is that all might be illumined by the light of unity and associate with one another in love and harmony, so that the whole earth may be regarded as one country and one land. However, those souls who are deprived of sincerity and purity have imagined the True One to be like themselves, and therefore strive and struggle to extinguish the divine light. Would that the servants knew! Would that the people understood! For if they became aware and discovered the Purpose, all would turn toward Him and would utter the blessed words “We belong to God.” Beseech the True One that He withhold not the rebellious from the ocean of His bestowal and bounty, nor deprive the ignorant from the effulgences of the Sun of knowledge, that all may discover and come. Blessed art thou, for thou hast attained to My mention in My prison - a mention that cannot be equaled by the mentions of the world and what the peoples possess. To this testifies He Who speaks in every condition that there is no God but He, the Single, the One, the Speaking, the All-Knowing, the All-Wise.

=== END BH10983 ===

=== START BH10984 ===

We send greetings to members of the Household, Mahd and others. Their deeds are accepted and their efforts appreciated. Ruqiyyih and Hubbiyyih are, God willing, holding fast to the cord of patience. In truth they are content and thankful. Blessed are they! Therefore, comely patience, and God is the Help to be sought against that which they describe.
