=== START BH10993 ===

PRAISE BE TO THE LORD OF EXISTENCE who hath made manifest the Path and guided His servants unto it. Glory be to God! The signs of divine favor are evident in all things, yet the people remain deprived thereof, save those whom God hath delivered through His grace and sovereignty. My spirit be a sacrifice unto your remembrance, your praise and your service. The numerous blessed letters from your honor were received. Each was as a door opened for those who seek and are sincere. Blessed is he who turneth unto the gate of God’s favor, the Lord of all worlds. After reading and becoming acquainted with their contents, we approached the Presence and, after gaining permission, presented them before the Countenance of the Desire of the worlds, and they attained the honor of being heard. His blessed Word, exalted be He:

O My Afnan! Upon thee be My glory and My favor. The Wronged One, in the midst of sorrows, maketh mention of thee with that which draweth thee nigh unto God, the Lord of the worlds. He hath aided thee through His verses and will aid thee through His clear proofs, and will assist thee through hosts whereby the doors of divine knowledge were opened to all who dwell in the realm of possibility, and the seal of the choice wine was broken through this Name that hath encompassed all creation. Blessed is he who hath testified to that which God hath testified, and hath acknowledged that which the Tongue of Grandeur hath uttered: verily, there is no God but Him, the All-Bountiful, the Generous. O My Afnan! Discord hath appeared among the servants, and vain imaginings have encompassed the dwellers of the earth. We beseech God, blessed and exalted be He, to protect His servants and to aid them through His sovereignty, and to confirm them in such steadfastness as neither the hosts of the world nor the power of those who have denied the Day of Judgment can shake. Convey My greetings to the faces of My loved ones and give them the glad-tidings of that which hath caused the ocean of life to surge at this time, and the Sun of the Covenant to shine forth by the command of God, the Lord of the worlds. Say: Beware lest the clamor of the idolaters frighten you. By God’s life! The Tree, though under the swords, remembereth His loved ones and counseleth them with that which exalteth them, and adviseth them to hold fast unto the cord of God, the Lord of the mighty Throne. We beseech God to adorn their temples with the ornament of steadfastness and to give them to drink of the Kawthar of His utterance from the hands of His bounty. He is verily the Giver, the Compassionate, the Forgiving, the Merciful.

Praise be to God! The glad-tidings have arrived and the hearts of the friends in these regions have been illumined with the light of joy, for His Afnan have succeeded in completing the edifice raised in the name of Truth. Your honor and the other Afnan - upon them be God’s grace, mercy and favor - this is a great bounty and an exalted station. This is an edifice that brightens the eyes of those near unto God and the Messengers. Your honor and the fair-minded know that this Wronged One hath neither taken nor desired aught for Himself. His purpose hath been the manifestation of God’s Cause and the exaltation of His Word. In the night seasons We summoned the servants to the horizon of grace, and in the daytime We occupied Ourselves with allaying the fire of hatred in hearts and souls. We beseech Him to assist all and grant them success in that which is befitting. He is the Powerful One whom the might of the world cannot weaken, nor can the power of the nations deter Him from His purpose. He is verily the Self-Subsisting, the Commander, the Ruler, the All-Knowing, the All-Informed.

Among the tidings that have brought joy to this Wronged One and His loved ones are the radiant effulgences of Abdul-Karim, upon him be the glory of God, the Mighty, the All-Knowing. This matter merits a hundred thousand thanksgivings. It is hoped that the loved ones in that land will hold fast to unity and concord, for should the fragrance of discord be diffused, it would lead to the abasement and humiliation of all. O party of God! This is the day of victory - deprive not yourselves thereof. Praise be to God, the manifest martyrdom in the City of Ya hath caused the exaltation of the Cause of God, and there hath been revealed specifically for them that which hath no likeness or parallel. Well is it with them and pleasant it is unto them. Tarry not in teaching the Cause, and make not yourselves deprived of true oneness like the previous party. All must read the Most Holy Book, that they may become aware of that which hath been sent down therein from the heaven of the Will of the Lord of the worlds. Time and again have We uttered this most exalted Word: mighty is the Cause and mighty is the Day. Blessed is the soul that hath freed and detached itself from all else save God and hath held fast unto the Truth - a holding fast which the hosts of the oppressors and the turning away of the deniers cannot sever or separate. Convey to each and every one of the loved ones the greetings and salutations of the Wronged One. By the life of God! They are present before Our face and are visible beneath the glances of Our loving-kindness. It is hoped that all may be assisted to achieve that which shall cause its fame to encompass the East and the West. Verily God is the All-Bountiful, the Generous, the All-Giving, the All-Knowing. The splendor shining forth from the horizon of the heaven of My mercy be upon you, O My Afnan, and upon My loved ones who have quaffed the choice wine of revelation from the hands of My bounty, who have stood before the faces of My servants saying: “The Kingdom, the Dominion, the Glory and the Power belong to God, the Peerless, the Single, the All-Compelling, the Self-Subsisting.”

Praise be to God! That which is a treasury of utterance for the unlettered, a stronghold of security for the fearful, and a source of riches for the poor, hath been made manifest. Grace and bounty have appeared in such wise that the tongue of the world is powerless to make mention thereof. From every direction hath come sorrow, and from every quarter are evident the signs of grief. Nevertheless, the Tongue of the All-Merciful speaketh from the Kingdom of Utterance such verses as are the very life of the world. This servant beseecheth the True One to transform the doubts and fancies of His servants into the light of certitude, that all may attain unto that which causeth the heavens and the earths and all things to rejoice in its mention and to be gladdened by its remembrance.

My God, my God! Deprive not Thy servants of the wonders of Thy bounty, and grant them their portion from the Kawthar of Thy utterance in such wise that it may seize them from themselves and draw them nigh unto Thee, O Lord of the worlds and Master of nations. There is none other God but Thee, the Omnipotent over what was and what shall be.

As to what was written concerning Haji Seyyed Mirza from Sedeh and Aqa Seyyed Muhammad, upon them be the Glory of God, after being presented before His presence, these manifest verses were revealed. He speaks, exalted and sanctified be He:

In My Name, the All-Knowing, the All-Wise[…]

O Siyyid Qabl-i-Mirza! The Wronged One of the world, from the Most Great Prison, that is, the fortress of Akka, hath turned toward thee and made mention of thee with such mention that when it issued forth from the mouth of the Divine Will, the earth revealed its treasures, the seas their pearls, the suns their radiance, the moons their light, the Mother Book its utterance and its word, the mountains their mines, and hearts and minds their wisdom and their secrets. Verily thy Lord is the All-Bountiful, the Almighty, the All-Compelling, the Mighty, the Effulgent. Can aught be compared with My Word? Nay, by My true Self! Can anyone enumerate what hath been sent down from the heaven of bounty? Nay, by the Lord of the Day of Judgment! Today every fair-minded one hath acknowledged the greatness of the Cause, and every mighty just one hath confessed his powerlessness and shortcoming. This is the Lord of all days and the captivating call to all peoples. Blessed is he who hath heard and found the fragrance of the utterance of God, the Mighty, the Wondrous. O Branch! Upon thee be My glory and My loving-kindness. We have made mention of thee through these verses whereby the Cry hath been raised, the ocean of oneness hath surged, and that which was hidden and treasured in God’s knowledge, the Lord of the exalted Throne, hath been manifested. O thou who gazest upon the Countenance! We counsel thee and those who have believed to observe trustworthiness, godliness, forgiveness and generosity, that the lights of virtuous character may shine forth and illumine the earth amidst this darkness that hath encompassed the kingdom of God, the All-Knowing, the All-Informed. The glory that shineth from the horizon of the heaven of revelation be upon thee and upon those who have hearkened, hastened, and answered their Lord, the Mighty, the Beloved.

And this is what was revealed for His Honor Aqa Siyyid Muhammad, upon him be the glory of God:

He is the One Who speaketh the truth amongst mankind.

O Muhammad! Reflect upon that which the wicked ones of Hijaz visited upon the Lord of the world, Ahmad. During the nights and days He was occupied with guiding the misguided and reforming their souls. Nevertheless they perpetrated that which caused the atoms to lament and the verses themselves to weep - a weeping that caused the dwellers of the heavens and earth to wail. No harm was evident, no opposition existed. Through the Most Great Mercy and Supreme Compassion, He summoned all to the highest horizon and gave them glad tidings of God’s infinite favors. The counsel of the Lord of existence left no impression upon the evil hearts of that obstinate people. They were like dried up trees, unworthy of fruit. Even now it is observed that whatever is planted in barren soil remaineth fruitless. We beseech God, exalted be His glory, to cultivate the soil of His people’s hearts through the hands of wisdom, that from the sowing of the seed eternal and enduring fruits may appear, and that He may cause all to attain true and everlasting life. This is the day of the friends, for the Book itself speaketh and heaven and earth uttereth praise and glory. Blessed is the servant who hath attained unto the hearing of God, the Mighty, the Praiseworthy, and the vision of God, the Lord of this exalted station. Make mention of the friends on behalf of the Wronged One, that perchance this mention may move them all from this earthly realm and raise them above the heavens. Verily God is the Almighty, the Powerful, and worthy to answer prayer. The glory that is manifest, resplendent, and shining from the horizon of the heaven of utterance be upon thee and upon My friends who have turned with illumined hearts unto God, the Almighty, the All-Forgiving, the Most Merciful.

As was previously stated, mercy took precedence, but now it is observed that mercy, bounty, grace, and generosity have all taken precedence, as is evident and manifest from the revealed verses. Enemies are visible from every direction. Regarding His Majesty the Sultan, in most of the Tablets there hath flowed from the Pen of the Lord of all beings that which diffuseth the fragrance of favor. Nevertheless, for forty years he hath not restrained his wrath for a moment, and thus have the rulers acted in ways the like of which the eye of creation hath never witnessed. This evanescent servant beseecheth the eternal Truth to enable all to attain unto that which draweth them nigh and leadeth them into His presence. Verily, the Cause is in His hands and authority is in His grasp. He doeth what He willeth and ordaineth what He pleaseth.

Concerning what was written about the investigation and inquiry by the officials of His Imperial Majesty - may God, the Blessed, the Most High, strengthen him - and the reply of Mirza Ali, verily this investigation is praiseworthy, for they will become aware of that which is acceptable in the sight of God, exalted be His glory. After presenting these matters before the countenance of the Goal of all the worlds, these exalted words were sent down from the heaven of will. His word, exalted be His glory, and all-encompassing be His grace and His knowledge: […]

O Afnan! Upon thee be My Glory! That which Mirza Abdul-Karim - upon him be My Glory - hath mentioned is the truth in which there is no doubt. However, these matters did not and do not require any question, for from the horizons of the heavens of Divine Tablets the Light of Commands and Laws hath dawned and shone forth, praise be to God. Therefore there hath not been and is not any veil over matters that would cause upheaval, agitation, clamor and discord. All the Tablets are sanctified from that which would cause the appearance of the fire of hatred in hearts and souls.

O Afnan! Upon thee be My Glory and My loving kindness! The Tablet of the Call was sent, and it beareth the Most Great Glad-Tidings. We previously commanded that a copy thereof be made and presented to the government that they might become aware of a gift that is sanctified and free from likeness and peer. And if copies thereof be spread abroad, it would cause certain matters to arise, therefore it is not permitted save after permission.

O Afnan! The King of Iran hath disappointed Us. Thou knowest that for forty years they killed, burned, and dismembered these people and cast them into pits, and not a single soul arose to defend them, let alone to fight. Nevertheless, His Majesty the King did not arise for justice. In his reign such tyranny appeared that Pharaoh, Nimrod, Shimr and Yazid have sought refuge in God from it. What heart could accept such tyrannies? Consider the lives of Siyyid Hassan and Siyyid Husayn in the Land of Sad, how Zillu’s-Sultan arose with such oppression. Now the cry of those two oppressed luminous lights is heard from the sands of Egypt. That unjust one without equity martyred those men after taking six thousand tumans in cash, and that same day three times did the attendants raid the women and children. In the first plunder they took the boxes and chests and ornaments, and likewise whatever was in the place of commerce - they took it all. They branded a hundred camels in the name of the government, and in the second raid they seized all the household furnishings, from carpets to vessels and other items. They confined the residents of the house in one room and locked the door, with no explanation given. After sunset the chief gardener of the prince went with porters and carried away all the flowers and trees that had been obtained from various places - that is, from Europe and India and China. Hath such cruelty ever had an equal in the world, or is there any likeness to it? Nay, by the Self of God Who standeth over the Letter Sin, and by the Cause of God that dominateth the world! By the life of God, because of the tyranny that occurred in Iran, the Faithful Spirit wept and the Most Great Spirit lamented. The lamentation of the Mother Book was raised up and the cry of the Point of the Bayan was heard. The decrees of His Majesty the Sultan had no effect beyond his own mansion […]

The cry of the Point of the Bayan was heard. The decrees of His Majesty the Sultan had and have no effect outside his palace. Glory be to God! In the days when the Sultan, in his own estimation, was commanding the oppressors of the earth to show forbearance and reject bribes, Zill-i-Sultan was collecting fines all around. Now reflect upon the ruler and the ruled, and take refuge in God. All know that this Wronged One has been a well-wisher of the government and people of Iran, and We have specifically mentioned Nasir in numerous Tablets and sought for him the good of this world and the next. However, the seat was not worthy of this supreme bounty. Ask God to transform the throne of oppression into the seat of justice. That which is the cause of joy to those near unto God after the supreme sorrow hath been revealed in the Most Holy Book. Again, make mention of the loved ones of that land on behalf of the Wronged One. O Abul-Fadl! Upon thee be the Glory of God, the Lord of Justice. Thou hast ever been and art still remembered. Blessed art thou and joy be unto thee. We beseech God to protect thee that thou mayest remember Him and be occupied with His praise. We hope that in this Revelation the loved ones may attain unto the lights of true Divine Unity, not like the Shi’ih sect who each day would carve an idol with their own hands and worship it. Among them was one who claimed to be the Fourth Pillar, who every year would write a refutation of the Primal Point and commit such acts as caused the dwellers of the highest Paradise to weep and lament. We beseech God to aid all to do that which He loveth and pleaseth. Verily He is the Lord of creation, the Lord of the Last and the First.

Blessed is the one who hath attained unto the recognition of the Day of God. The taunts and turning away of the servants did not prevent him from drawing nigh unto the Lord of creation. He testified among mankind to the Lord of Names. This evanescent servant beseecheth God, exalted be His glory, to open the door of His bounty unto the faces of His loved ones and to raise them all from the depths of poverty to the heights of wealth. He is verily the Powerful, the Mighty, in the Last and the First.

In your second letter mention was made of the wishes and desires of the loved ones, upon them be the Glory of God. After being submitted before the Most Holy Presence, it was graciously accepted. Some phrases were somewhat modified and sent. We beseech God, blessed and exalted be He, to adorn His servants with attentive ears and penetrating eyes. Verily He is the Lord of all creation.

Regarding what you wrote about the beloved of hearts, His Honor Mirza Abul-Fadl, upon him be the Glory of God and His favors, it is now commanded that remaining in that place is most appropriate and preferable.

As for your mention of the receptivity and detachment of the people of Bukhara and Samarkand, it is indeed exactly as you have written. After being submitted before the Seat of Grace, these exalted words issued forth from the Dayspring of the Will of the Revealer of verses. He speaks, exalted be His utterance and mighty His proof: He is the One Who calleth unto truth […]

O my God, my God! Thou seest Thy Afnan and Thy loved ones turning unto Thee, clinging to the Tree of Thy grace and holding fast to the hem of Thy bountiful robe. O Lord! Illumine the earth and heaven with their light, and send down upon them what Thou didst send down upon Thy chosen ones and trusted ones. O Lord! Thou seest the Afnan standing in service to Thy Cause and voicing Thy praise amongst Thy creatures. I beseech Thee to open before their faces the portals of Thy knowledge and wisdom, that they may draw the servants nigh unto the court of Thy glory and the carpet of Thy holiness. O Lord! Unite through Thy most exalted Word the hearts of all people, that the world may be illumined with the light of Thy oneness and the radiance of Thy singleness. Verily, Thou art the One Who hath power over whatsoever He willeth. There is none other God but Thee, the Hearer, the Answerer.

As to those souls who are sanctified, assured and well-pleased - whomsoever they deem fit may journey each year from the City of Love to those regions, that they may guide with spirit and fragrance, with wisdom and utterance, the dwellers of the dusty earth to the highest horizon. Great indeed is the reward for this blessed and accepted deed. Blessed are they that act.

This is a day of thanksgiving and praise, nay rather, a day for the manifestation of all the divine names and attributes. Blessed is the soul that hath arisen for the sake of God and held fast to the service of His Cause.

Regarding the Most Holy, Most Exalted Tablet of the Call, whatsoever ye have deemed expedient and mentioned hath been adorned with the honor of acceptance, and after being presented at the Most Holy, Most Exalted Court, He said: “O My Afnan! Upon thee be My glory and My loving-kindness. The Tablet of the Call is among the greatest bounties of God, exalted be His glory. It hath no peer or likeness, for whatsoever was the cause of agitation, discord, conflict, disputation and corruption - all this hath been erased from the Book by the hand of power, and whatsoever was conducive to peace, unity, harmony and reconciliation hath been recorded by the Most Exalted Pen. Its allusions are the quickeners of the world and its utterances are the water of life for all peoples. By My life! No bounty can equal this most great bounty, and no matter this momentous matter.” Praise be to God, the mighty and glorious Empire is the supporter of this community, and we beseech God at all times that He may aid His Majesty the Emperor to assist this Revelation, that all the horizons of the world may be illumined by the splendors of the light of His justice, and that the oppressed ones among all parties may find rest in the cradle of security and comfort, and may voice their prayers for the perpetuation of his eternal sovereignty. Verily, He is the One Who hath power over whatsoever He willeth through His word “Be” and it is.

In these days news of the yellow wind is reaching us from the assembly of the wise ones and physicians, but until now its appearance hath been prevented and its advent barred. And afterward the matter is in the hand of God, our Lord and the Lord of all worlds.

Among the recent news is that the revered Afnan, His honor Aqa Mirza Aqa, upon him be the Glory of God, the Lord of all beings, and the beloved of hearts, His honor Nazir, upon him be the Glory of God, have arrived. Among the fresh tidings is that due to the wickedness of the wicked, the door of retribution has been opened. His Majesty the King of Iran did not read the Tablet of God, and now as recompense he must repeatedly read letters from which the fire of hatred blazes forth from the horizon of every word, until an answer befitting the question is given, and likewise with telegrams. Take Iran in ruins, for it has kindled either a new fire in the earth or the fire of divine wrath. From every direction it has encompassed the bewildered king, robbing him of sleep and rest. Tribulations have so encompassed him that his messenger found no opportunity to deliver his master’s messages. However, as commanded, the people of justice must in no way interfere. They must remain with perfect dignity and composure. Nothing contrary to propriety or opposed to righteousness should be manifested by them, for the station of this party today is sanctified above the ways of the world’s parties. To the extent possible, they should strive to quench the blazing fire that burns against the government and nation. It is hoped that praiseworthy and pleasing qualities and conduct will be manifested by this party. In truth, a great sedition has arisen against the government - to this bears witness He with Whom is the clear Book.

Regarding the construction of the Mashriqu’l-Adhkar, and obtaining permission and documents for His honor Aqa Ghulam-’Ali from the people of Ya, and renewed special permission for His honor Aqa Mashhadi Rida, upon them both be the Glory of God, and the correspondence of His honor Aqa Ghulam-Husayn and Aqa Rida and Aqa Khayru’llah, upon them be the Glory of God, and the departure of the known leaf from the land of Ta - all these matters were presented before the holy and sanctified Throne of Truth and attained the honor of being heard. His blessed and exalted Word […]

O Afnan! Upon thee be my Baha! Praise be to God that thou hast succeeded in constructing the Mashriqu’l-Adhkar of God, whose remembrance and fragrance shall endure and persist as long as the Kingdom endureth. However, considering that the honored Afnans (upon them be my Baha and loving-kindness) have from the earliest days assisted the Cause of God with hand and tongue, with hearing and sight, all the atoms of creation have testified and do testify to the service, devotion, sincerity and purity of these sanctified souls. Glory be to God! In times of difficulty and distress, those blessed souls have again attained unto this special blessed station. Before this Wronged One, whatsoever was for the acquisition of the House was bestowed in Alexandria - thou thyself knowest this - and whatsoever was in the storehouse in Beirut was given to settle the debt of one of the believers, and the details of both are clear and evident to thee. Had there been means available, it would have been sent specifically for the construction to thee. Although whatsoever both of you possess - that is, thyself and the other one (upon both of you be my Baha and loving-kindness) - is considered the pure property of this Wronged One. By chance, on this blessed night, the supplication of the honored Afnan was specifically read in the presence, and likewise some time ago, and before that. From each word, nay from each letter, nay from each dot thereof, the fire of love was ignited. God willing, may the bestowals of the Most Great Ocean and the gifts of the Sun of Truth encompass them.

As regards the proceeding of the leaves to the Land of Ta, this matter was left to Ali-Qabl-i-Haydar (upon him be my Baha) to execute whenever he deemed it advisable. However, their movement appears very difficult, and thy proceeding to the Land of Ta is not permitted. Although the Sultan is now secretly remorseful for what he hath wrought against this wronged community, God willing, may His grace take hold of him and enable him to compensate for what he hath missed in the days of God.

As for the permission at the time of presentation, it was granted in the presence, and whatsoever the friends of that land have sent hath been accepted according to what was mentioned in the letter. We beseech God to assist all to do that which He loveth and is pleased with. Give them the glad tidings of My acceptance and illumine them with the light of My utterance and remind them of My verses which have preceded all who are in the heavens and on earth. O Afnan! Verily thy Lord mentioneth at the end of the utterance he who was named Rida in the Book of Burhan, and We give him the glad tidings of My acceptance of him and My turning toward him and My mention of him in days wherein My heart and My pen and My outward and My inward being and My loved ones who have sacrificed their wealth and their souls in the path of God, the Lord of the worlds, have lamented. Both Jinab-i-Rida and his parents have had and continue to have permission to proceed. Praise be to God, the father attained unto that which was recorded and inscribed in the divine Books, and likewise the son. Upon them both be the glory of God and His loving-kindness and the grace of God and His mercy.

O my God, my God! I remember Thee through Thy two servants who did not break Thy Covenant and Testament, who soared in Thy atmosphere and attained to Thy remembrance and praise. O Lord! Ordain for them and for those who love them, both male and female, that which Thou didst ordain for the Companions of Sinai in this Revelation whereby the pavilion of glory was raised up, those in the graves arose, and the law of resurrection was made manifest. There is no God but Thee, the Mighty, the Powerful, the All-Forgiving.

Furthermore, regarding the mention of the passport that was seized in Bukhara: if Bukhara is firmly and definitively under the protection of its august government, there is no harm in obtaining a passport and it would be good. It would be better and more appropriate to inquire also from the spiritual friend, Aqa Ali-Haydar, upon him be the Glory of God, as he is aware of some of the laws of the august government, may God strengthen it. In any case, I have beseeched and continue to beseech God, exalted be His glory, for your honor’s dignity and elevation. On one occasion, these exalted words were heard from the Master of all beings. He said that the Afnan, praise be to God, has been blessed in his attention and steps. Although he has endured hardship, since he has succeeded in rectifying certain matters, the hardship is comfort. We beseech God to exalt him through His grace and favor and to ordain for him and his Afnan the best of this world and the next. Verily, He is the Giver, the Bestower, the Mighty, the Generous.

Manifest verses have been revealed especially for the mentioned names, upon them be the Glory of God. It is hoped that all will attain unto them. Verily our Lord is the Forgiving, the Merciful.

This petition was about to be sent when your telegraphic news arrived, and since a response was issued from His presence, the sending was delayed until another herald brought new tidings, and that was your blessed letter which brought spiritual glad-tidings on the morning of the twenty-fifth of Rabi’u’th-Thani. After opening and reading the letter, such joy and delight took hold that at that very moment it was presented to His presence and fully conveyed. Then the divine ocean of utterance surged and the effulgences of the Sun of Knowledge encompassed the world to such an extent that no one was or is capable of enumerating it. Then these sublime words were revealed and made manifest from the Dayspring of Utterance, His words, exalted be His utterance and mighty be His proof: […]

O Afnan! Upon thee be My Glory and My Loving-kindness! Praise be to God that the realm of darkness hath been illumined by the light of guidance, and the parched desert of thirst hath been refreshed by the waters of divine mercy. This is indeed a great bounty and its station exalted. We beseech God to increase, day by day, His confirmations upon you, and to render your purpose so refined that its manifestation through the realm of utterance may captivate the world. Exalted is the penetrating power of My sweetest utterance and My most glorious remembrance! Blessed are those Afnans who have arisen to aid My Cause, who have taken the Kawthar of utterance from the hand of My bounty and have drunk therefrom once in My Name and again in remembrance of Me, through which the horizons of the heavens of wisdom and utterance were illumined. We beseech Him, exalted be He, to ordain for them and for My loved ones that which will make them the lights of His Kingdom in His earthly realm and the mysteries of His wisdom in His perspicuous Book.

O Afnan! The letters which thou didst send previously to this servant, each one hath been favored with loving-kindness, mercy, grace, attention and response. Well is it with thee and with My loved ones who have attained with joy unto the cup of martyrdom in My path. The ecstasy of the cup of martyrdom transcendeth all earthly delights. Whosoever partaketh thereof will, with utmost joy, eagerness, longing and gladness, hasten to the station of sacrifice. O God! Grant us, through Thy loving-kindness, Thy grace, Thy mercy, Thy power, Thy might and Thy sovereignty, for verily Thou art the All-Powerful, the Almighty. There is no God but Thee, the All-Knowing, the All-Informed.

Concerning what thou didst mention about the gathering of the loved ones in a special council for the conduct of affairs, this hath been accepted. In truth it is necessary. At the beginning of the entry of the Wronged One into the military barracks in the city of Akka, the establishment of a council was decided upon. However, due to changes of location and variations in movement and rest, it was postponed. And concerning what thou didst write about the unity, harmony, joy, gladness, delight and happiness of the Afnan and the loved ones - this became the cause of joy and exultation. We beseech God to assist all to remain steadfast in what was mentioned at every moment, for truly the manifestation of discord hath been and is the cause of the dissipation of God’s Cause. The world is not worthy of mention. Erelong its carpet shall be rolled up, save the carpet that is spread in the name of Truth through the endeavors of His loved ones - that shall endure in the world through the perpetuity of the Most Great Name. We beseech God to assist all in that which will cause His Cause to be exalted and His traces to encompass all. Verily He is the All-Bountiful, the Generous.

The signs of victory and triumph are evident from every direction. Blessed are they who have directed their endeavors to the exaltation of the Cause and who are occupied with the greatest steadfastness in uniting hearts and souls. We hope that the three mentioned souls may be illumined and gladdened by the effulgences of the Tree of Sinai, and We beseech God, exalted be His glory, to grant them success. Were all the peoples of the earth to become aware of the leaves and fruits of the Blessed Tree, they would all expend their endeavors in its service.

They mentioned the consultative council and the blessed, assured souls therein. Praise be to God, each one hath been honored with the mention of the Wronged One and special favors. Divine confirmation and assistance circle round the loved ones. Soon their names, their mention and their deeds shall be spread throughout the East and West of the earth - a promise from Us. Verily thy Lord fulfilleth His promise through His sovereignty and power. He is the Powerful, the Mighty.

Reflect upon the manifest power in the earth. In a moment He transformed punishment into sweetness and hardship into mercy, to such extent that the oppressor repeatedly acknowledged his error and in utter abasement sought Our good-pleasure. And were he to know what hath been ordained for him, he would cast himself into the fire, or flee to the mountains and lament until death. Thus was the matter decreed in the Mother Book by God, the Powerful, the Mighty, the Subduer.

What transpired - the martyrdom of the martyrs who attained the supreme triumph, likewise the exaltation of God’s Word among those within and without, and the manifestation of power and might in that transformation - each is a clear testimony to the power, grandeur and all-encompassing nature of God, exalted be His glory. Blessed are they who know and blessed are they who have attained. However, if mention of the gathering and consultative council is made to the government and permission is obtained, this would be most preferable, seemly and excellent. The splendor shining from the horizon of the heaven of My grace be upon My Afnan and My loved ones who have acknowledged and confessed that which the Tongue of Grandeur hath spoken before the faces of the servants. The Command is in God’s hands, the Lord of creation and the Commander in the beginning and the return.

The new sublime letter was indeed a book of joy for the friends. There was no delay whatsoever in responding to it - the moment of its presentation and the moment of response occurred in one place and time. Your services to the divine Cause have each been adorned with acceptance and divine good-pleasure. Now, since you have given the glad tidings of presence through the penetrating, swift missive, therefore many are waiting. I beseech God, exalted be His glory, to grant you complete health and perfect well-being, and to cause you to attain the Most Great Scene with boundless joy and delight. And may you receive with supreme profit all that has been delayed during this period. Blessed is God, our Lord, Who bestows a hundred thousand Euphrates of nearness for a single drop from the sea. Who can reckon His grace and mercy? Who can count His favors and gifts? We beseech God to increase the endeavors of His loved ones there and to ordain for them from the Pen of His grace the verses of His mercy, His favor, His generosity and His bounty. Verily, He is powerful over all things.

As to what you wrote regarding the trees, fruits and seeds, after presenting it He said: “God willing, may the trees and seeds that the honored Afnan has obtained be planted like the trees planted in the Most Holy Place in the Most Great Name, and may they appear with new and distinguished fruits, and may their mention remain eternal and everlasting until the end that has no end. Blessed be the tree, blessed be the fruit, blessed be the speaker, and blessed be the hearer.”

Whoever has spoken these words has spoken exceedingly well: “The prayer is from Thee and the answer too is from Thee.” I bear witness that He was his helper in receiving, and likewise his confirmer in planting, and similarly He aids in receiving again and grants success in partaking, through His grace, His favor and His beneficence. Blessed and exalted be the glory, the remembrance and the praise upon your honor and upon those who are with you and who hear your words concerning God, our Lord and your Lord.

=== END BH10993 ===

=== START BH10994 ===

In My Name, the Most Exalted, the Most High!

O My handmaiden! And know thou that My words are a light by which the hearts of the yearning ones are illumined, and a fire by which the hearts of the lovers are consumed, and a fountain of life by which My loved ones are quickened, and a wine by which My chosen ones are intoxicated, and an ocean wherein are treasured the pearls of My wisdom, and a treasury wherein are deposited the gems of My knowledge. Blessed is he who hath attained unto the recognition of My Self, and soared in the atmosphere of My love, and ascended unto the heaven of My gracious favors, and immersed himself in the ocean of My divinity, and discovered the sweet fragrances of holiness from the garment of My grace, and hath sanctified himself from all else save Me, and turned with his heart unto the sanctuary of My greatness, and arose to aid My Cause, and walked in the ways of My good-pleasure.

O My handmaiden! Remember thy Lord in thy standing and thy sitting, in thy sleep and thy wakefulness. By God! He who loveth Me sleepeth not even when sleeping, nor is he occupied with aught save My remembrance and My love and My praise, even should he be engaged in all the affairs of earth. Rejoice, O My handmaiden, then grieve, O My servant woman. As for the rejoicing, it is for My manifestation and My dawning and My effulgence and My exaltation and My radiance and My power and My glory; and as for the grief, it is for My anguish and My exile and My distress and My imprisonment and My tribulation. Glad-tidings unto him who readeth this and findeth that which is diffused therefrom. And upon thee, O thou who hast desired thy Lord within thyself and hast been invested with the robe of His guidance, and upon all handmaidens, pure ones, devoted ones, seeking ones, hoping ones, remembering ones.

He is the Ever-Abiding

I beseech Thee by Thy Most Holy, Most Glorious Beauty to make the hearts of Thy servants sanctified from self and desire, that Thy love may be established therein, O Thou Who hast raised up the heaven. Verily Thou art God; there is none other God but Thee, the One Who dominates all things and Who has power over all things, by Thy Most Glorious Name.

=== END BH11071 ===

=== START BH11072 ===

In the Name of our Most Holy, Most Great, Most Exalted, Most Glorious Lord! Glorified art Thou, O God of Names and Creator of heaven! I beseech Thee by the leaves of the Divine Lote-Tree, and by its fruits, branches, boughs and rustling, that Thou change the fire of separation from Thy loved ones into the light of reunion with Thee, and their remoteness into nearness unto Thee. Verily, Thou art the Ancient One, possessed of great bounty. There is none other God but Thee, the Mighty, the Generous.

=== END BH11072 ===

=== START BH11073 ===

He is the Most Holy, the Most Great! Glorified art Thou, O God of the land and whatsoever moveth thereon, and Lord of the sea and whatsoever swimmeth therein! I beseech Thee by the Name through which the heaven of Thy Cause was raised up and the sun of Thy Will shone forth, to illumine Thy earth with the light of Thy justice and the radiance of Thy countenance. Then ordain for Thy loved ones that which will make them independent of all else save Thee and draw them nigh unto Thee. Thou art, verily, the Almighty, the Powerful.

=== END BH11073 ===

=== START BH11074 ===

In the Name of our Most Holy, Most Great, Most Exalted, Most Glorious Lord!

Glory be unto Thee, O God of the unseen and the seen! I beseech Thee by Thy Name, the All-Loving, which hath encompassed all that is seen and unseen, to ordain for him who hath turned unto Thee a station beneath Thy shade. Verily, Thou art the All-Bountiful, the Generous. Verily, Thou art the All-Outpouring, the Merciful. Verily, Thou art the Munificent, the Giver, the Mighty, the All-Knowing.

=== END BH11074 ===

=== START BH11076 ===

O Abu-Talib, upon him be the Glory of God! He is the Wronged One. The Most Exalted Pen beareth witness unto him who hath turned unto God, the Lord of all beings, and hath quaffed the choice wine of steadfastness from the hands of bounty and bestowal. He, verily, is the All-Witnessing, the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing, the All-Informed. Glory be unto those who have attained unto the lights of the Countenance when the All-Merciful came with manifest sovereignty.

=== START BH11078 ===

His glory be exalted! God beareth witness that there is none other God but Him, and He Who speaketh is verily the Most Great and Hidden Treasure Who hath appeared in truth as a bounty from His presence - verily He is the All-Bountiful, the Most Generous. The Supreme Pen hath acknowledged thy turning unto God, the Lord of the Throne and of the dust, and thy submissiveness before the Throne and thy self-effacement at the Gate.

=== START BH11079 ===

He is God, exalted is He! God testifies that He is the All-Powerful, the All-Compelling, the Self-Subsisting. He has appeared and revealed whatsoever He willed. Nothing escapes His knowledge. He is the Truth, the Knower of the unseen. He gives to drink the choice sealed wine through His Name, the Self-Subsisting, and gives glad tidings to His branches of that which hath been ordained for them from His Most Exalted Pen - that which cannot be mentioned by any mention. And He is the Mighty, the All-Choosing.

=== END BH11079 ===

=== START BH11081 ===

The holy maidens of the celestial throne and the veiled beauties of the divine paradise and the immaculate houris of the pavilion of chastity and the maidens confined to the tabernacle of virtue are, upon the carpet of the throne of beauty, engaged with the spirit of fellowship in melodious songs and heavenly anthems, that perchance dead hearts may come to everlasting life and divine melodies and attain the presence of their Beloved.

=== END BH11081 ===

=== START BH11082 ===

O friends of God in Shahrud! He is the One Who speaks in the Kingdom of Utterance!

My God, my God! Hearts have melted in separation from Thee, and the hearts of Thy servants are consumed in remoteness from Thee. My God, my God! The cries of the lovers have risen from all regions, and the lamentations of the chosen ones in their separation have ascended. Thou hast, O my God, manifested the Dayspring of Thy signs and the Dawning-place of Thy revelations, that all who dwell in Thy heaven and earth might be honored by meeting Thee, yet the polytheists and the heedless have interposed themselves between them and the effulgences of the light of Thy countenance. O Lord! Thou seest the faces turned toward the gleaming lights of Thy countenance, the hearts drawn to the horizon of Thy manifestation, the tongues uttering Thy praise and speaking of what hath befallen them from the fire of separation from Thee, and the eyes awaiting the wonders of Thy mercy and the manifestations of Thy nearness and Thy presence. Wilt Thou deny them, O my God, after the ocean of reunion hath surged through Thy name and Thy command, and the horizon of meeting hath shone forth with the luminary of Thy generosity and grace? O Lord! Thou seest the hands of hope clinging to the hem of Thy bounty. I beseech Thee by the breezes of Thy revelation, the pearls of the oceans of Thy knowledge, and the manifestations of Thy sovereignty amongst Thy creatures, to ordain for Thy loved ones reunion with Thee and attainment unto Thy presence. Then cause them to hear Thy sweet call before Thy throne, or inscribe for them, with Thy Most Exalted Pen, the recompense of attaining unto the gate of Thy grandeur, which Thou hast opened before the faces of all in Thy dominion.

My God, my God! Thou knowest and seest that there hath come before the Wronged One, in His Most Great Prison, a leaf whereon were inscribed the names of Thy loved ones who have drunk the choice wine of recognition from the cups of Thy gifts and the Salsabil of certitude from the hands of Thy grace. I beseech Thee, O God of Names and Creator of heaven, by Thy Name through which Thou hast transformed fire into light and removed the veils from hearts and minds, to aid them to remain firm with supreme steadfastness, that their feet may not slip through the doubts of the transgressors and the hints of those who have turned away - they who have broken Thy Covenant and Thy Testament, who have disputed Thy signs, disbelieved in Thy proof, and turned aside from Thy evidence after it had encompassed Thy earth and Thy heaven. I beseech Thee, O Lord of eternity and Sovereign of nations, to assist them to recognize the Source of Thy laws and the Manifestation of Thy Self. Then remember those whose names have been presented before Thy face, that they may rejoice in Thy remembrance, Thy acceptance, and Thy attention. Verily, Thou art the Most Generous of the generous ones and the Most Merciful of the merciful. Bounty is in Thy grasp and generosity in Thy right hand. Thou doest what Thou willest and ordainest what Thou pleasest. Verily, Thou art the Mighty, the Praiseworthy.

O Ghulam-Rida! The Wronged One remembereth thee from the precincts of the Prison and counseleth thee with that whereby the Cause of God, the All-Possessing, the Self-Subsisting, may be exalted. Take hold of the Book with strength from Us in such wise that the doubts of those who have disbelieved in God, the Lord of existence, may not hinder thee. Arise with supreme steadfastness in the Cause of thy Lord, the Lord of all beings, and say: O peoples of the earth! Fear God, the Lord of the Throne and of the dust, and be not of those who have denied God’s favor when it was sent down through grace. Turn with illumined hearts to the Most Sublime Horizon. This is what ye have been commanded, both before and after. He beareth witness to this Who hath spoken in every condition that there is none other God but Me, the Truth, the Knower of the unseen. Say: By God! The horizon of certitude hath been illumined by the Light of proof. Fear ye God and follow not the sources of idle fancies and vain imaginings. He Who was hidden in the universe and mentioned in the hearts of the Prophets and inscribed by the Most Exalted Pen in the Books of God, the Lord of the seen and unseen, hath been made manifest. Thus have We revealed unto thee the proof and sent down that whereby thine eyes and the eyes of those who have attained to revelation and witnessing may be solaced.

O Heydar-’Ali! The Most Exalted Pen makes mention of thee and counsels thee with that which hath been revealed in the Book. Be thou eloquent in My remembrance, steadfast in My Cause, directed towards Mine horizon, firm in My path, and holding fast to the hem of the robe of thy Lord’s grace, the Lord of creation. A single letter of thy Lord’s verses is worth more than all that is witnessed and seen, as attested by the Mother Book which is with Him. Blessed is the soul that hath attained unto My days, the heart that hath turned unto My countenance, the man that hath arisen to serve My Cause, and the eye that hath beheld the lights.

O ’Abdu’l-Karim! The Wronged One makes mention of thee and gives thee glad tidings of God’s loving-kindness, the Lord of all beings, and counsels thee with that which befitteth the days of God, the Lord of Lords. Turn not unto the world and its conditions and what transpireth therein. All that is therein shall perish, and that which hath been revealed from the Pen of thy Lord’s Revelation, the One Who ruleth over all in earth and heaven, shall endure. We have sent down the verses and dispatched them unto those who believed when God came with power and sovereignty. Blessed is he who hath attained unto the knowledge of his Lord, and woe unto every heedless doubter.

O Pen! Make mention of him who hath been named Muhammad and reveal unto him that which will draw him nigh unto the Mighty, the Bestower, Who hath appeared and manifested what He desired. He it is Who hath spoken and caused all things to speak: “There is none other God but I, the Mighty, the Self-Subsisting.” When thou hast attained unto My verses and found the fragrance of Mine utterance, say: “Praise be unto Thee, O my God, for having enabled me to recognize Thee and for having acquainted me with Him Who was hidden within the treasuries of Thy power. I beseech Thee to assist me to be steadfast in Thy Cause. Verily, Thou art the Almighty over whatsoever Thou willest. Within Thy grasp are the reins of all things. There is none other God but Thee, the Self-Sufficient, the Most Exalted.”

O Shaykh Muhammad! Hear My call and remember My days and what hath befallen Me at the hands of those among My tyrannical servants who denied My manifestation, My appearance, My dawning, and My verses which have encompassed the horizons. We make mention of thee and counsel thee with that which will manifest man’s station among the religions. Exalted is the All-Merciful Who created thee and caused thee to know this Cause whereby feet have slipped. Let not the doubts of the opposers sadden thee, nor the onslaught of those who have disbelieved in God, the Revealer of verses. Be thou steadfast in the Cause of thy Lord and speak forth My Name amongst the servants. Thus hath the fragrance of revelation been wafted throughout the world, yet most of the people are wrapped in heedlessness and veils.

O Baqir! Hear the call from the right side of the luminous spot at the Lote-Tree beyond which there is no passing. Verily, there is no God but Him, the Mighty, the All-Forgiving. Blessed is the penitent who hath turned unto God, and the humble one who hath submitted to this Cause whereby necks have been laid low. Beware lest the veils of the world withhold thee or the onslaught of those who have denied the Source and the Return cause thee to fear. O Rida! Hear the call that hath been raised between earth and heaven, calling all unto God, the Manifestation of clear evidences. By God! He hath come, before Whom the verses have bowed down and around Whom the Manifestations of the Cause from thy Lord, the Lord of Lords, have circled. Be thou so steadfast in the Cause that the hearts of the wicked ones who have denied God’s proof and evidence and committed that which hath caused the clouds to cry out, shall not disturb thee. Thus hath My Most Exalted Pen spoken upon the branch of eternity. Blessed is he who hath heard, and woe unto every froward denier.

O Mulla Ali! The Lord Who hath come with truth, with power and sovereignty, maketh mention of thee. By God! Neither do the Pharaohs hinder Him, nor do the oppressors frighten Him. He hath appeared and revealed whatsoever He desired. He, verily, is the Herald in the realm of destiny. Behold the effects of My Most Exalted Pen and ponder thereon. Verily it will draw thee nigh unto the Most Glorious Horizon and will open before thy face the gate of joy and ecstasy. Beware lest the clamor of the people of the Bayan debar thee from the Dawning-Place of the revelation of thy Lord, the All-Merciful, or the deeds of those who have disbelieved in God, the Lord of Days, cause thee to grieve. Say: O people! Be fair in the Cause of God and follow not those who have cast the Book of God behind their backs, clinging to idle fancies and vain imaginings. Thus hath the Truth spoken as a token of His grace. He, verily, is the Protector over what is and what shall be.

O Muhammad-Qabli-Husayn! The oppressors of the earth have unsheathed the swords of hatred against the countenance of God, the All-Compelling, the Self-Subsisting. They have committed that which hath caused the dwellers of the all-highest Paradise and this glorious station to lament. Say: O people of the Bayan! Fear ye the All-Merciful and follow not those who have denied that which hath been sent down from the Most Exalted Pen in this perspicuous Tablet. The verses have been revealed and the evidences have appeared, yet the people do not understand. Blessed is he who hath turned with his heart to the Most Exalted Horizon, and whose face hath turned toward the face of God, the Lord of what was and what shall be. Thus did the Pen move when the Ancient King was established upon the Most Great Throne and proclaimed: “There is none other God but Me, the Mighty, the Loving.”

O Muhammad-Qabli-Hasan! The rustling of the Sadratu’l-Muntaha hath been raised and the water of life hath flowed in the realm of creation. Blessed is he who hath heard and drunk thereof, and woe unto every heedless one who is veiled. Beware lest the veils of the learned keep thee back. Take thou the chalice of My bounty and drink therefrom My choice sealed wine. How many a learned one hath been debarred from the Known One, and how many an ignorant one hath drawn nigh and said: “Praise be unto Thee, O Lord of the seen and the unseen, for having manifested Thyself, sent down Thy verses and guided Thy servants unto Thy straight path!”

O Ali! The Wronged One maketh mention of thee at this manifest time and calleth thee unto God, the Lord of the worlds. Beware lest anything prevent thee from God, the Lord of Names, or the intimations of the heedless ones, who have cast the Truth behind their backs, turning unto every remote ignorant one, veil thee. Cast away what the people possess and take that which thou art bidden by God, the Mighty, the Praiseworthy. Thus have We sent down the verses and explained them in truth as a command from Us, and We, verily, are the Powerful, the Mighty.

O Husayn! Hearken unto the scratching of My Most Exalted Pen. Verily, it hath been raised between earth and heaven, and the fragrances of revelation have been diffused in all directions. That which hath befallen the Wronged One in the path of God hath not prevented the trees from yielding their fruits, nor the ocean of inner meanings from its waves. But the One Who conversed on Sinai speaketh and saith: “O people of the earth! Cast away what ye possess and take what hath been given you by God, the Lord of Lords.” We have arisen to promote the Cause in such wise that the clamor hath not deterred Us from the remembrance of God, the Lord of all men. We proclaimed before the faces of the world: “The Promise is come and this is the Promised One Who calleth you unto God. Turn ye unto Him and be not of those who disbelieved in the bounty of God and disputed His signs that have encompassed the horizons.” Thus hath the cock crowed and the Dove of the Cause warbled upon the branches.

O Mulla Hasan! The Supreme Pen hath never paused for an instant; it moveth and speaketh, and through its movement all things were set in motion and all created things appeared. The whole world was created for this Most Great Revelation. This fact hath been mentioned in the Books of old and those that followed, and is manifest today. The Herald, the Primal Point, took the essence of the Bayan and revealed it in these exalted words. His word is this: “I have written the essence concerning His mention, which is that He cannot be known through My allusions, nor through what hath been revealed in the Bayan.” This word is the essence of the Bayan, nay the sovereign of the Bayan. Although this Most Great Revelation, by the testimony of all the sacred Books, hath never needed any proof or evidence other than itself. Its verses have encompassed the world, and the manifestations of its power are clear and evident. Blessed is the eye that hath seen and the ear that hath hearkened.

O Abul-Qasim! The Wronged One maketh mention of thee. From the earliest days until now, both night and day, before the eyes of all men, we have made mention of God, exalted be His glory. The river of mercy hath ever flowed from the Pen of the Dayspring of Revelation, and when some trace of its effects became manifest, certain souls rose up in opposition–more severe than the opposition of the former people who martyred the Lord of all beings–and some spoke words beyond all bounds. The heedless souls have made and continue to make claims. The people of God must be vigilant and aware. The Cause of God hath never been, nor will it ever be, the plaything of the ignorant. If every day someone were to make a claim, God’s Cause would become suspended and delayed among the people. This matter is clear and evident to those possessed of insight. God willing, may all unite and, through their unity, illumine the horizons with the light of this dawning.

O Habib! Hearken unto the voice of Truth that hath been raised from the direction of the Prison. By God’s life! His Word is the sovereign of all words, and His utterance the king of all utterances. Were all the ears on earth to hearken aright, all would turn to the Most Exalted Horizon and would return from that which they possess to that which is with God. The Sun of Truth is shining, the ocean of inner meanings is surging, and the heaven of knowledge is adorned. This Day is unlike all other days, and this Revelation unlike all other revelations. Blessed are they who have turned unto it and attained the recognition of God. Know ye the value of these divine days. By My life! Neither the treasures of earth nor all that it containeth can equal them. He, verily, is the All-Bountiful, the Most Generous.

O Ali! God willing, mayest thou remain steadfast in the Cause of God and hold fast unto His praise with such firmness that the world shall have no power to deter thee.

Blessed are the people of Kha who have heard the Call and answered their Lord, the Speaker, the All-Knowing. We have repeatedly made mention of the people of that land. We beseech God to set them all ablaze with such fire that through the heat of the love of God all the peoples of the world may be attracted. One of the people of Kha, named Muhammad, attained Our presence. He hath heard what the near ones have heard. We beseech God to protect him and enable him to make mention of Him and praise Him.

O Pen! Make mention of him whose book was present before the Throne and who was named Mirza Baba. Verily We make mention of him and of My loved ones who have believed in God, the Lord of the worlds. O people of God! Take heed lest anything prevent you or the hosts of the world weaken you. Arise with supreme steadfastness in the Cause of God, the Lord of all humanity. He hath aided you, caused you to know Him, drawn you nigh unto Him, and He is the Compassionate, the Generous. O Baba! Each of the names of the loved ones mentioned in thy letter hath been recorded by the Most Exalted Pen and is being sent, that all may be set ablaze and hold fast unto that which He loveth and is pleased with. We counsel all to act in accordance with that which hath been sent down in God’s Book from the Pen of His command. It guideth you to the straight path and biddeth you to that which will exalt your station amongst the religions. The glory be upon thee and upon them and upon My maidservant and My other maidservants (Hajiyih Bigum and Zahra). Give them the glad-tidings of My loving-kindness, My grace and My mercy. Verily thy Lord is the Forgiving, the Merciful, and He is the All-Hearing, the All-Seeing, and He is the Manifest, the Responsive.

=== END BH11082 ===

He is the Most Holy, the Most Great! Well is it with thee, for thy letter hath attained unto the presence of the Throne, as the Wronged One walketh and uttereth the verses of God, the Lord of all worlds. We make mention of thee as a token of Our grace, that thou mayest give thanks unto thy Lord, the All-Forgiving, the All-Bountiful. Wert thou to know, thou wouldst soar upon the wings of longing by virtue of thy having been mentioned by this wondrous Pen.

Ye are they whom neither the might of princes held back from the Lord of Names, nor the croaking of the raven from your Lord, the Mighty, the All-Bestowing.

He is the Glory of the Most Glorious!

Thee and bows down before Thee, that I may be protected therein

through Thy bounty and kept safe within it from the darts of those who

have disbelieved in Thee, through Thy strength. Thou, verily, art the

Potent, the Mighty, the All-Powerful, the All-Merciful.

Vouchsafe, then, unto him the good of both this world and the next, and grant unto him the station of righteousness in Thy presence, that his feet may not slip from Thine all-glorious and most exalted path.

=== START BH11102 ===

In the Name of Him Who ruleth over the worlds!

O My loved ones in the world! Hearken unto the call of the Dayspring of Revelation from the precincts of His sanctified House, which God hath made the circling-point of the Concourse on High and the Dawning-places of His Command from time immemorial, that the call of God may gladden you and sanctify you from the world and its sorrows, and draw you nigh unto the Dayspring of grandeur and power. We have remembered those who have turned towards the Countenance, and have made it a treasure for them in Our worlds which none hath known save His Own Self, the All-Encompassing over all possibility. Blessed are ye, O My loved ones, for having attained unto the Goal when the learned and princes turned away, and for having drunk from the Kawthar of life when every heedless doubter was debarred therefrom. Ye are they whom the veils of men hindered not, nor were ye kept back by the intimations of such as disbelieved in God, the Lord of all men. Ye have turned with radiant faces toward the Most Exalted Horizon and have heard the call of the Lord of Names when it was raised betwixt earth and heaven. Rejoice ye, then give thanks unto your Lord, the Mighty, the All-Bestowing. How many a king desired to attain Our presence, and how many a scholar lamented for the days of attainment, yet when the appointed time was fulfilled and the Horizon of Revelation shone forth, they kept back from it and held fast unto their own opinions. The world was created for the Most Great Day. Verily He hath come with the truth, but the people are in doubt and dissension. The world hath been illumined through the revelation of Our Most Great Name: among men some have recognized while others have not. Blessed is he who hath heard and perceived and said: “Praise be unto Thee, O Dawning-place of the signs!” Turn, O My loved ones, with radiant hearts toward the seat of the throne of your Lord, the Lord of Names. Then aid Him through remembrance and utterance. The doors have been barred and the doorkeeper standeth ready. Should God so will, He will open them through the key of His Most Great Name and drive them away through His sovereignty that hath encompassed all created things. When anyone desireth to enter into the presence of the Throne, they speak concerning him that which causeth the dwellers of Paradise and the Concourse on High to lament. He is, in truth, the Mighty, the All-Knowing. We have forbidden the people from coming into Our presence, because of what the hands of such as were heedless of the Command have wrought and who followed every wicked deceiver. It behooveth everyone to act according to what hath been commanded by God, the One, the Chosen. Beware lest remoteness sadden you. Whoso hath today attained unto recognition and acted according to what was commanded, he is reckoned among those who are nigh in the Mother Book. Consider the favor and bounty of God - He remembereth you through grace in this Prison which was built of solid rock, and sendeth unto you that which will solace your eyes. Follow ye the commandments and laws of God, and hold fast unto the hem of the mercy of your Lord, the Cleaver of the Dawn. Hold ye fast unto the cord of unity in the path of God, the Lord of creation. Through your unity the hearts of them that have disbelieved in the Beginning and the End shall be shaken. Teach your children to recite the verses of God at morn and at eventide. God hath prescribed for every father to educate his children, both male and female, in learning and letters, then crafts and professions. Thus have We taught you in Our Most Holy Book which We have sent down from Our hallowed Kingdom. Blessed is he who hath laid hold upon it through Our power. He is of the people of this station. Strive ye that there may appear from you that which beseemeth the days of your Lord, the Lord of all men. The glory be upon you and upon those who have attained unto what ye have attained and have drunk the Kawthar of life from the hands of the bounty of your Lord, the Lord of Religions.

=== END BH11102 ===

=== START BH11103 ===

He is the All-Hearing, the All-Seeing!

The ocean hath surged and the divine fragrance hath wafted, and the Day is come, yet the people are in manifest doubt. The Cry hath been raised and the Hour hath appeared and the Trumpet hath been sounded, when He Who conversed with God took His seat upon the throne of Revelation and the Herald proclaimed: The Kingdom is God’s, the Almighty, the Self-Subsisting! Glory be to those who have believed in God, the Mighty, the Loving!

=== END BH11103 ===

=== START BH11104 ===

God the Most Glorious! The ocean of divine knowledge has surged when the fragrance of the All-Merciful was diffused. Enter, O people of Baha, into the Crimson Ark, then board it in My Name, the Most Exalted, the Most High. Blessed art thou for having attained unto the Kawthar of My utterance in My days and for having acknowledged that which My Tongue hath acknowledged in the kingdom of My wondrous expression.

=== END BH11104 ===

=== START BH11106 ===

In My Name, the Most Holy, the Most Ancient, the Most Great! Say: O my God! Thou seest me standing before the throne of Thy grandeur, hearing Thy call, gazing upon Thy countenance, holding fast to the cord of Thy bounty, and clinging to the hem of Thy grace. I beseech Thee to assist me in serving Thy Cause, then to unite my scattered affairs that I may become capable of teaching Thy Cause. Verily, Thou art the All-Powerful, the Most Exalted, the All-Knowing, the All-Wise.

=== END BH11106 ===
